What would happen if you took the original Torah or Bible and shred it to pieces? How would it affect the earth and evolution? Would science even exist? Because science was created when some person decided to become too curious for his or her own good. Would we evolve for the better or for the worse. Would there be no wars. Because the Holocaust would not happen. Nor will there be as big of a problem in the Middle East. Would there? What would happen if Mohammed never came out of the desert  after seeing his vision, and Islam would never be born? What would happen if Jesus Christ was not the man the bible depicts him as? Was there really a flood that covered all the earth? That is up to you to discuss. What Would Happen...

 That's a fairly broad question! I'll just touch on a few of your questions.
 
 Would science have happened. Yes, probably even sooner and with greater strength. People want answers. For generations people felt "God did it" was a sufficient answer. Without religion the quest for real answers would have started sooner.
 
 Would the Middle East be a problem? Yes. The reason that the Middle East has so much influence isn't Islam, it's oil. Whatever the culture of the people there, whatever their beliefs, the fact that they live on top of a giant oil reserve will give them an undue amount of influence.
 
 The Haulocaust? No, without Jews it obviously couldn't have happened as it did. However, Hitler was just looking for someone to use as a rallying point for the German people. Without a religious scapegoat he would have chosen some other group to persecute. He did go after gays and gypsys, he could easily have added more groups to that list. 
 
 To answer your question in broader terms would require a novel. A novel which could very well make a good read, and which I assume someone must have written. Anyone have any suggestions?

 Man is created in God's image. Created for His pleasure to worship Him. We are hardwired to worship...that is what makes us human. Pre-Historic humans we know from archeological digs believed in a spiritual something..often many things.
 
 When mankind had evolved to the point He deemed us worthy, He revealed Himself First thorugh Abraham, then Noah, the Moses, David, John The Baptist...and finally Chirst -- God's own Son.
 
 What would happen if religion did not exist?.....Then we would not be humans...we would be like all the other anilmals...where the only motivations are self-preservation, procreation and pleasure.

 somebody would convince a bunch of people that life must be more than just being born and dying. this "revelation" would open an arena for the possibility of "something out there" that is larger than life, giving some kind of lasting significance to what seems like a fleeting existence in a vast context. people agreeing with this view would find a hope in their acceptance of life being more than an in-and-out deal, and band together with those that feel the same way
 
 eventually, you'd end up more or less with what we have tody
 
 as far as science is concerned, there never a personal or selfish motive. somebody saw something happen, and wondered how that happened. just good ol' curiousity. the parents of science are "why" and "how". as long as humans are curious to answer these questions, there will be science

Dzeron

In this hypothetical scenario where religion never existed, I think that we would have had the Enlightenment back in 2000 BCE or something. Then, all the early civilizations would have been liberal republics rather than monarchies, and by now we would probably have a much more libertarian and egalitarian society than we do today.
 
 Of course, the former requires the latter. Religion would never have arisen unless someone forces someone else to beleive something. That is why religion is steadily losing ground in modern republics. In order for religion to never have existed, we wouuld need to have established a liberal republic in early history.
 
 But, alas, those who were strong enough to form any kind of government were more interested in power than political philosophy. Thus, history went otherwise, and liberalism has been fighting an uphill battle since the dawn of time.

 When I say "liberal society," I am referring to modern republics. Religion is on decline in the United States - the Chrisitan population percentage has dropped by 7% over the last ten years. I haven't seen statistics of this nature on other countries, but I've heard that religion is declining in Europe as well. I read a French newspaper article that seemed to take the statement "religion is bad" for granted, and the newspaper was considered one of the more conservative ones in France.

i think if the world had no religion (no churches, no God, etc) nothing else in the world would be much different. science would advance faster (cloning, jurassic park, etc), and maybe people would be more callous and less sensitive about people's feelings.
